page.title: 01GAZETTEER - S.E. WIRKSWORTH
page.content: THE AREA IS MAINLY RURAL, WITH A GREAT DEAL OF MIXED FARMING. THE SOUTHERN PENNINES PLAY A MAJOR ROLE CREATING HILLS AND VALLEYS THAT ARE STEEP AND NOT SUITABLE FOR MAJOR CROP PRODUCTION. WIRKSWORTH IS THE TOWN IN THE AREA THAT PROVIDES MOST OF THE SHOPPING FACILITIES. THE QUARRIES TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA ARE THE SOURCE OF INDUSTRY FOR THE MEN ALONG WITH FARMING AND LORRY DRIVING. A FEW LIGHT INDUSTRIES AND LOCAL GOV. ALSO EMPLOY MANY PEOPLE. CLOTHING MANUFACTURE PROVIDES A LOT OF PART-TIME WORK FOR WOMEN. LOCAL DERBYSHIRE DIALECT IS QUITE STRONG. G IS SOUNDED ON THE END OF WORD. H IS DROPPED BUT RARELY ADDED. FARMLAND, TREES, HOUSING AND THE TUNNEL FOR THE CARSINGTON RESERVOIR ARE THE THINGS THAT STAND OUT.
